result.execSummary:
The defendant Darquice J Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of supervision.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment and treatment, domestic violence counseling and cognitive intervention counseling. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. May have non-violent contact with victim. Must remain compliant with any child support orders. Defendant must submit a DNA specimen, as required by law, and pay for the testing. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Parties have reviewed PSI.  No corrections or additions noted by parties. The State recommends time to be left up to the Court consecutive to time currently being served.

for furlough allowing deft to attend funeral of his grandmother. Deft may be released from Racine County Jail no later than 7 am on Monday, March 9, 2015 and is to return to Racine County Jail no later than 5:00 pm Monday, March 9, 2015.

Defendant Darquice J Edwards in court with attorney Robert William Peterson.  Defendant Darquice J Edwards in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.

The Court received a handwritten document by the victim asking the no contact be provision be lifted. Mr. Repischak is covering the case and has not seen the motion nor has he had an opportunity to speak with the victim. Time is allowed for the State to review the motion and speak to the victim, who is present.

The State does not object to the no contact provision being lifted, but asks that a prohibition be given that the parties may not discuss the case.

BTC: request to modify bond is denied
